results.title: Big people, little people
results.brief_description: A big city is inhabited only by Little People (children) who do all the things Big People usually do - as policemen, train drivers, postmen, builders, housewives - but this leaves the play-grounds empty. However, the mayor is wise and sends for some Big People to take over the work of the city.

results.title: Big nose: Takeshi Hoshino with the Tasmanian Puppet Theatre
results.brief_description: This film explores the concept of puppetry as an art form as it goes backstage at the Tasmanian Puppet Theatre. Takeshi Hoshino, art director from Japan’s Puk Theatre designs and directs the production of “Big Nose”, a traditional Japanese story. Suitable for years prep-6 and lower secondary levels.

results.title: The Big muster
results.creator_credit: Ben Burgandy, Lex Halliday and A M P Society
results.brief_description: Shows the rural holdings of the Australian Mutual Provident Society, and its contribution to the cattle industry in Australia. This is a record of the contribution the A.M.P. Society and its policyholders are making to the Australian beef industry. Shows pasture improvement on established properties, development of new pastures and marketing.

results.title: The Big mill
results.creator_credit: Laurence Henson, Jack Holmes and Templar Film Studios
results.brief_description: The Big Mill is a steel strip mill at Motherwell, outside Glasgow. The film follows the processes of making, testing and rolling hot steel slabs and sheeting, destined for use in every branch of modern life.

results.title: The Big island [Cinemascope print]
results.creator_credit: Frank Bagnall and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: The aim of this film is to show an international audience within a limited time span some attractive aspects of Australian life. Representing Australia as a brisk and exciting place and creating a mood of a young country on the mood. Cinematography by Keith Gow and Don McAlpine. Music by George Dreyfus. (Awards: AFI Travel Award 1970)

results.title: A Big hand for everyone
results.brief_description: The average man, in ignorance and confusion, has an optimistic view of his future. The expert, wrapped in his knowledge and expertise, is pessimistic. It is this disparity of belief that the political cartoonist and humorist, Bruce Petty, animates in his film. Petty sees the world and its problems as complex. He shows Man as a lonely figure on a unicycle, pedalling hard towards disaster. Awards: Golden Reel Award, AFI Awards 1971.

results.title: The Big gull: Karoro: New Zealand's black-backed gull
results.creator_credit: Grant Foster, Derek Wright and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: The New Zealand black-backed gull is one of 44 species that has adapted its natural way of life, to benefit from the wasteful habits of man. With naturalist Sir Robert Falla.

results.title: Big game fishing in Australia
results.creator_credit: Dennis Hill Productions, Joe Scully and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Australian waters are an exciting setting for big game fishing. Not only are the fish big and full of fight, but the Great Barrier Reef provides a setting of unequalled beauty. This film captures the excitement of a world record marlin catch by New Zealander Sir William Stevenson in the waters off Cairns, in Northeast Australia. It weighed 1231 lbs.
